intro: Schkuhria bigelovii, commonly known as the bigelov's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globe-shaped flower heads, which are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Schkuhria bigelovii is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds.
